items.q: Which instrument has black and white keys and is often featured in classical music?
items.explanation: The piano has 88 keys, typically colored black and white, and is a staple in many musical genres.
Standard acoustic and electric guitars have 6 strings, though variations exist.

items.q: Beethoven was famous for composing mostly hip-hop music.
items.explanation: Beethoven was a renowned composer of classical music.

items.q: Explain what a choir is in music.
items.a: A choir is a group of singers who perform together as a group.
items.explanation: Choirs often perform vocal music with multiple parts and harmonies.

items.q: Name the four main families of instruments found in a traditional symphony orchestra.
items.explanation: These four families form the core ensemble of a standard orchestra.

items.q: What is the purpose of a conductor in an orchestra?
items.a: A conductor leads the orchestra, setting the tempo, ensuring musicians play together, and guiding the interpretation of the music.
items.explanation: The conductor uses hand gestures or a baton to cue the musicians.

items.a: A microphone captures sound waves from the air and converts them into electrical signals so they can be amplified or recorded.
items.explanation: Microphones are essential for live vocal performances and studio recordings.

items.a: Tempo refers to the speed or pace of a given piece of music.
items.explanation: It determines how fast or slow the music should be played.

items.q: What is the difference between an acoustic guitar and an electric guitar?
items.a: An acoustic guitar projects sound naturally through its hollow body, while an electric guitar requires an amplifier and speakers to produce sound at performance volumes.
items.explanation: Acoustic bodies act as a resonant soundboard.

items.q: Who is often referred to as the 'King of Pop'?
items.explanation: He earned this title due to his immense influence on music, dance, and popular culture.
